channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'My role was making movies that mattered,' says Jodie Foster, as 'Taxi Driver' turns 50
item.description: Foster was just 12 years old when she starred in the 1976 film. "What luck to have been part of that, our golden age of cinema in the '70s," she says. Her latest film is Vie Privée (A Private Life).
item.content:encoded:
Foster was just 12 years old when she starred in the 1976 film. "What luck to have been part of that, our golden age of cinema in the '70s," she says. Her latest film is Vie Privée (A Private Life).

(Image credit: Gareth Cattermole)
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Keep an eye out for these new books from big names in January
item.description: The new year begins with a host of promising titles from George Saunders, Julian Barnes, Jennette McCurdy, Karl Ove Knausgaard and more. Here's a look ahead at what's publishing this month.
item.content:encoded: The new year begins with a host of promising titles from George Saunders, Julian Barnes, Jennette McCurdy, Karl Ove Knausgaard and more. Here's a look ahead at what's publishing this month.
item.dc:creator: Colin Dwyer

item.title: Scott Adams, the controversial cartoonist behind 'Dilbert,' dies at 68
item.description: Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture from the '90s until a controversy in 2023.
item.content:encoded:
Adams announced in May that he was dying of metastatic prostate cancer. Thousands of newspapers carried his strip satirizing office culture from the '90s until a controversy in 2023.

(Image credit: Lea Suzuki)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 'Fly, Wild Swans' is Jung Chang's painfully personal tribute to her mother
item.description: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.
item.content:encoded: A historian of modern China, Jung Chang turns the lens back on herself in her newest book to understand how she sees the world and why she writes about China today.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Today is the Smithsonian's deadline to give thousands of documents to the White House
item.description: The White House says the Smithsonian Institution must submit materials about current and upcoming exhibitions and events for a review that will determine whether they express "improper ideology."
item.content:encoded:
The White House says the Smithsonian Institution must submit materials about current and upcoming exhibitions and events for a review that will determine whether they express "improper ideology."

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Lost overnight, a 6-year-old was found by a man who ignored search teams' advice
item.description: When he was 6 years old, Thomas Sinclair wandered away from his family's campsite on Lake Superior and got lost. At dawn he heard a voice that has shaped his life ever since.
item.content:encoded: When he was 6 years old, Thomas Sinclair wandered away from his family's campsite on Lake Superior and got lost. At dawn he heard a voice that has shaped his life ever since.

item.title: 'The God of the Woods' novelist Liz Moore describes the rare 'flow state' of writing
item.description: Moore says writing is mostly labor, but "2% of the time, usually at the very beginning of a book and the very end of a book, it feels like flying." She's the author of Long Bright River.
item.content:encoded: Moore says writing is mostly labor, but "2% of the time, usually at the very beginning of a book and the very end of a book, it feels like flying." She's the author of Long Bright River.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies

item.title: 'Hijack' and 'The Night Manager' continue to thrill in their second seasons
item.description: Idris Elba returns as the world's most unlucky traveler in Season 2 of the Apple TV series Hijack. And Tom Hiddleston is back as a hotel worker/intelligence agent in The Night Manager on Prime Video.
item.content:encoded: Idris Elba returns as the world's most unlucky traveler in Season 2 of the Apple TV series Hijack. And Tom Hiddleston is back as a hotel worker/intelligence agent in The Night Manager on Prime Video.
item.dc:creator: John Powers

item.title: Who are the figure skaters representing Team USA? Key names and backstories to know
item.description: Sixteen U.S. figure skaters are competing in all four Olympic disciplines: men's, women's, pairs and ice dance. The team includes a mix of seasoned vets, world champions and rising stars.
item.content:encoded:
Sixteen U.S. figure skaters are competing in all four Olympic disciplines: men's, women's, pairs and ice dance. The team includes a mix of seasoned vets, world champions and rising stars.

(Image credit: Brian Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: How IVF has led to a record number of single moms in their 40s
item.description: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.
item.content:encoded: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.
item.dc:creator: Pallavi Gogoi
